explanation.rules:
Rules:
• The system is duodecimal (base 12).
• Units = 1 gwìnìŋ; 2 bà; 3 tàt; 4 nààs; 5 tùŋūn; 6 tīīmìn; 7 tàāmà; 8 rwīīt.
• “ʃāā‑α” = 12 − α (1 ≤ α ≤ 3): 9 = ʃāātàt, 10 = ʃāàbà, 11 = ʃāàgwìnìŋ.
• 12 = kūrū.
• Multiples of 12: bā‑kūrū bī‑γ = γ × 12 (2 ≤ γ ≤ 8).
• Complements to 12×12: bā‑kūrū ʃāā‑bī‑γ = (12 − γ) × 12 (1 ≤ γ ≤ 3); the first‑syllable tone of γ becomes middle.
• Additive construction: β ná gwɛ̄ gwìnìŋ (δ = 1) or β ná vɛ̀ δ (2 ≤ δ ≤ 11) yields β + δ, where β is any multiple of 12 (β = k × 12).
